The gun has gold (TiN, titanium nitride) plating on the following externally visible parts- Clark custom trigger, trigger pivot pin, mainspring housing assembly(backstrap), extractor, bolt stop pin, magazine release, safety button, bolt stop thumbpiece, hammer pivot pin, and the (4) grip panel screws (2 each side).  This pistol sports a New Hogue black rubber wrap around grip with finger groves.  The bolt in this gun is plated Matte shiny chrome (by APW) and wears the official Ruger black bird logo on the rear of the bolt head.  The Clark custom trigger records a 1 pound 11.7 ounce average of 6 pulls on my digital Lyman trigger pull gauge.  It comes with two magazines, one like new magazine which I test fired the gun with after the custom work was completed and one new magazine which still has the paper sticker on it that shows it is new and unused.  The original factory grip panels and factory letter accompany this sale.  The bore is excellent and it does not appear to have been shot excessively.  Being that it was made in 1983 I of course do not have the original factory box as I bought the gun in an Estate acquisition for customizing due to its superior condition at the time.  No information was on hand at the time of sale to determine who the original buyer of the gun was.  This gun is a beauty being that the black and gold plating combination really sets it off coupled with the engraving. It is durable being that two layers of plating are present and the fact that black chrome will not rust.  This is one to keep for generations to come!  I respectfully say that the weapon is priced at near my cost of the custom work involved.  I do not build these guns to get rich on them, only because it is my passion to make these guns like that which Ruger doesn't!
